comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
I just realized about this issue and completely agree with you on this. I've reviewed the policy, but still, blocking just a tiny part of the video for a few seconds does not justify keeping such important information away from a consumer. 

Imagine this scenario: a person who knows a bit about computer set up an adblocker for their friend and family member, or enable the filter on their own computer. They trusted this filter because it's from a reputable company, and they would not think that such an important consumer information would be considered so annoying that they'd be worth blocking, unlike something like cookie pop-ups. 

Now they will not know whether or not a product was given to a YouTube creator for free and/or the creator was paid to make the video unless if the creator is ethical enough to also inform them inside the video and didn't think "I marked the video as paid promo, nothing more I need to do." (Creator space is currently unregulated in many regions & they can easily get away with it)

Now their minds are influenced by sponsored content, even if the creator use the option to put a disclosure up for their audience.

Wouldn't it be strange if an adblock filter blocks all the paid disclosures from a news website while still leaving the article up for the user to read, now without knowing if the article is actually paid for? 
Something like this should be in a much more niche filter, not a relatively standard ones like this.

At the very least, it'd be a great idea to clearly state that this filter is going to block a banner informing the user when a content is sponsored by someone so people knows what they're getting into.

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Blocking ads in the Waze app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

While running a custom DNS server I was able to block all ads in the waze app by blocking any connections from advil.waze.com

^ This should help you block all ads from the app.

I'm currently using your iOS DNS profile & your private DNS servers on Android, would really appreciate it if you could add this to your blocklist.

### Proposed solution

Add advil.waze.com to the SDNS filter

### Additional information

CRM ID: 611235

issue.title: Unchecking "Enabled on this site" does not disable the annoyances filters for the site
issue.body:
@piejanssens commented on [Tue Jun 07 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718)

<!--  As an open-source project with a dedicated but small maintainer team, it can sometimes take a long time for issues to be addressed so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
-->

### Prerequisites

Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. **YOU MAY DELETE THE PREREQUISITES SECTION.**

- [X] I am running the latest version
- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### Issue Details

<!--- Please include all relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

* AdGuard for Safari version: 1.11.4
* Environment name and version: Safari 15.5 (17613.2.7.1.8)
* Operating System: macOS 12.4.0
* Filters you use in AdGuard: ads, privacy, annoyances (EasyList Cookie List, I don't care about cookies, AdBlock warning removal list), language-specific (NL)


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
If I uncheck "Enabled on this site", I expect any AdGuard to no longer affect the site in any way.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Some filters are still being applied. I am certain that this is a bug in AdGuard as I can get the wanted effect by disabling the AdGuard all-together via the "Pause AdGuard for Safari" option.

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

<details><summary>Screenshot:</summary>

<!--- drag and drop, upload or paste your screenshot to this area-->

</details>

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

---

@Birbber commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150112013)

@piejanssens Hi! Could you give an example of the webpage so I could check it on my end?

---

@piejanssens commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150120107)

Hi @Birbber,

1. Enable the "I don't care about cookies" annoyance filter.
2. Visit https://www.era.be/nl/te-koop
3. Notice you can't scroll
4. Disable AdGuard on the site
5. Notice you still can't scroll...
7. "Pause AdGuard for Safari"
8. Accept the cookies
9. Notice you can scroll

comment.body:
@Birbber @Alex-302 
I don't think a site specific whitelist or fix is the correct patch for this. The era.be site was just an example. The issue is in general. 

Btw. same issue on iOS, website whitelisted, yet filters are still being applied:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/829098/173770910-5ab98f23-17a1-4afe-89b9-5277a1751339.png)

issue.title: Blocking ads in the Waze app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

While running a custom DNS server I was able to block all ads in the waze app by blocking any connections from advil.waze.com

^ This should help you block all ads from the app.

I'm currently using your iOS DNS profile & your private DNS servers on Android, would really appreciate it if you could add this to your blocklist.

### Proposed solution

Add advil.waze.com to the SDNS filter

### Additional information

CRM ID: 611235

comment.body:
In the past that domain seemed to break the app.

https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts/issues/760

So user has currently no problems at all when it is blocked?

issue.title: Filter issue causing problem with and android app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

dns.adguard.com

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kaufland.Kaufland&hl=ro&gl=US

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Hello, on my android device I'm using dns.adguard.com as my private DNS, The issue is with a retailer app (kaufland app -package:com.kaufland.Kaufland). Since an update about 3 weeks ago, whenever I try to access the leaflet (the supermarket catalogue) from within the app get a network error. If I revert the phone to my ISP DNS, the app works normal, so I guess it is a bad AdGuard filter. Can you please fix it? Thanks.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75840436/173083326-98640e6a-7519-44c1-bcf6-44c65e5ccd71.mp4




### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Blocking ads in the Waze app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

While running a custom DNS server I was able to block all ads in the waze app by blocking any connections from advil.waze.com

^ This should help you block all ads from the app.

I'm currently using your iOS DNS profile & your private DNS servers on Android, would really appreciate it if you could add this to your blocklist.

### Proposed solution

Add advil.waze.com to the SDNS filter

### Additional information

CRM ID: 611235

@Alex-302 is specific_app automatically migrated to DNS filter or do I have to move to adservers?

issue.title: Blocking ads in the Waze app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

While running a custom DNS server I was able to block all ads in the waze app by blocking any connections from advil.waze.com

^ This should help you block all ads from the app.

I'm currently using your iOS DNS profile & your private DNS servers on Android, would really appreciate it if you could add this to your blocklist.

### Proposed solution

Add advil.waze.com to the SDNS filter

### Additional information

CRM ID: 611235

comment.body: @BlazDT according to the [configuration file](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/blob/master/configuration.json), you should move it to the adservers.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings.

---

Browser extension users should install `AdGuard Extra` script into `Tampermonkey` extension.

`AdGuard Extra` download link:
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

After install `Tampermonkey`, change these options like on screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/68199152-23c17800-ffc6-11e9-99f2-13643aa771ae.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/68200995-a3047b00-ffc9-11e9-9999-cdcf35a0f750.png)

comment.body:
I can't reproduce it, but it seems that we have more similar reports, for example here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/4290 and here - https://forum.adguard.com/index.php?threads/twitch-buffering-every-couple-of-seconds.48205/#post-222273
It looks like that disabling AdGuard Extra fixes problem for one user (issue from forum).

```
@@||mindray.com^$stealth
```
to user rules and then check if website load correctly?

issue.body:
Включите расширение AdGuard Extra в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить скрипт `AdGuard Extra`. Для этого понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
### ВНИМАНИЕ

Пользователям программы для `Windows`, `macOS` или `Android` нужно включить расширение `AdGuard Extra` в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить [расширение AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra) либо скрипт `AdGuard Extra`(этот вариант может не везде срабатыавать). 

<details><summary>Установка скрипта  "AdGuard Extra" в расширение "Tampermonkey"  :</summary>

Для установки скрипта понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

</details>

comment.body:
### ВНИМАНИЕ

Пользователям программы для `Windows`, `macOS` или `Android` нужно включить расширение `AdGuard Extra` в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить [расширение AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra) либо скрипт `AdGuard Extra`(этот вариант может не везде срабатыавать). 

<details><summary>Установка скрипта  "AdGuard Extra" в расширение "Tampermonkey"  :</summary>

Для установки скрипта понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

</details>

@Nzzyme commented on [Thu May 26 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2082)

https://www.instagram.com/p/Cd_cSNJls9g/

Using Edge Browser with AG extension for Edge. No ad/tracking filters applied. Only the "Stealth" mode is applied with the following settings: https://prnt.sc/YZh3D9na8Fym

Still when I reload the page, no videos play on Instagram (logged in). Disabling AG Extension and then reloading the page plays the video. Please fix.
 

---

pull_request.title: eksisozluk.com, fixes search-box text ads
pull_request.body:
"sponsorlu" list items removal and search box placeholder ads text hiding,

tested on Firefox (Windows), Chrome (Windows), Chrome mobile mode via DevTools (Windows)

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ OK ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ OK ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ OK ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ OK ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?
hides/removes search box ads on eksisozluk.com.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?
Search box ads become hidden and removed.

### Enter the issue address

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located






1. Your comment

They put text ads into search box placeholder. My fix hides it. They add 2 list items (`<li>`) to search results. I removed them from DOM. Also there is a text "sponsorlu" (means sponsored) next to the search box. My fix hides it. 

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot placeholder ads (before fix):</summary>

![ekşi-searchbox1-bf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10234479/173846855-e9a25c5c-5af2-4822-bcf4-4a88feaf2eac.PNG)


</details>
<details>
<summary>Screenshot placeholder ads (after fix):</summary>

![ekşi-searchbox1-af](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10234479/173847520-43a5feb5-b0df-4617-b804-6dda6595d9d2.PNG)


</details>
<details>

<summary>Screenshot search results ads (before fix):</summary>

![ekşi-searchbox2-bf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10234479/173846864-ed6489af-48da-4793-9666-215187434696.PNG)

</details>
<details>
<summary>Screenshot search results ads (after fix):</summary>

![ekşi-searchbox2-af](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10234479/173847538-1e96cf3d-7a5f-4a3f-8861-266ab1423edb.PNG)


</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: Blocking ads in the Waze app
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

While running a custom DNS server I was able to block all ads in the waze app by blocking any connections from advil.waze.com

^ This should help you block all ads from the app.

I'm currently using your iOS DNS profile & your private DNS servers on Android, would really appreciate it if you could add this to your blocklist.

### Proposed solution

Add advil.waze.com to the SDNS filter

### Additional information

CRM ID: 611235

comment.body:
you guys are legends, amazed at how quickly this was assessed and merged!

I reported this adserver by the way and [I can confirm](https://i.imgur.com/eiDBPlv.jpg) the popup ads on both iOS and Android are being blocked by your DNS servers.

Just bought a monthly sub, thank you!!!

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение 30-60 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

issue.title: Unchecking "Enabled on this site" does not disable the annoyances filters for the site
issue.body:
@piejanssens commented on [Tue Jun 07 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718)

<!--  As an open-source project with a dedicated but small maintainer team, it can sometimes take a long time for issues to be addressed so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
-->

### Prerequisites

Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. **YOU MAY DELETE THE PREREQUISITES SECTION.**

- [X] I am running the latest version
- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### Issue Details

<!--- Please include all relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

* AdGuard for Safari version: 1.11.4
* Environment name and version: Safari 15.5 (17613.2.7.1.8)
* Operating System: macOS 12.4.0
* Filters you use in AdGuard: ads, privacy, annoyances (EasyList Cookie List, I don't care about cookies, AdBlock warning removal list), language-specific (NL)


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
If I uncheck "Enabled on this site", I expect any AdGuard to no longer affect the site in any way.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Some filters are still being applied. I am certain that this is a bug in AdGuard as I can get the wanted effect by disabling the AdGuard all-together via the "Pause AdGuard for Safari" option.

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

<details><summary>Screenshot:</summary>

<!--- drag and drop, upload or paste your screenshot to this area-->

</details>

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

---

@Birbber commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150112013)

@piejanssens Hi! Could you give an example of the webpage so I could check it on my end?

---

@piejanssens commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150120107)

Hi @Birbber,

1. Enable the "I don't care about cookies" annoyance filter.
2. Visit https://www.era.be/nl/te-koop
3. Notice you can't scroll
4. Disable AdGuard on the site
5. Notice you still can't scroll...
7. "Pause AdGuard for Safari"
8. Accept the cookies
9. Notice you can scroll

comment.body: @piejanssens Could you please list these sites[next time]? Some generic rules may hide popups, but sometimes scrolling is locked.
